title: TWICE’s Mina still undecided on return to group
text:
TWICE are celebrating their fourth anniversary (Picture: Getty Images)

TWICE fans were ecstatic when Mina rejoined her bandmates over the weekend, but they shouldn’t get their hopes up too much for her permanent return.

The 22-year-old made a surprise appearance at a fan event to celebrate the fourth anniversary of TWICE’s debut on Sunday.

It sparked hope that Mina would be back with Nayeon, Jeongyeon, Momo, Sana, Jihyo, Dahyun, Chaeyoung and Tzuyu on a more permanent basis, but it’s all still up in the air according to JYP Entertainment, who have clarified the situation.

The label said in a statement: ‘Mina herself personally wanted to join the fans for the fourth anniversary fan meeting. After discussions with the members, we decided that she would start by participating in the performance.

‘Her future schedule has not yet been decided. As we previously announced, [her decision to participate in TWICE’s activities] can change depending on her condition [at the time], and we will prioritise the state of her health above all else when coming to a decision.’

In July, Mina was forced to pull out of TWICE’s TWICELIGHTS world tour due to anxiety.

At the time, JYP Entertainment explained that the singer was ‘struggling’ with ‘sudden extreme anxiety and insecurity towards performing on stage’.

Mina is taking time out to deal with severe anxiety (Picture: Getty Images)

The label said they were consulting with medical professionals to find the best way to treat Mina’s anxiety. They also stated that they take the health of their artists seriously, and would do ‘everything possible’ to ensure Mina was able to recover fully.

Earlier this month, TWICE landed their first music show with for their new single Feel Special. It was their first single since Mina stepped away from the group.

After performing the special fan event this weekend, TWICE are now heading off to Hokkaido, Japan to continue their tour.

The group are set to release their second Japanese album, &TWICE, on 20 November.
